questions.neutral: Is the city acting weird lately?

hobby.message: Analog photography survive another day in Stenograd?
Any new mods on your FPV quad?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: Yeah, things feel off. Systems glitching more often lately.
I fly drones, so I notice when the city’s rhythms shift.
Too many new faces at the yards last week. Not normal.
Saw a couple of weird patrols during my flights. Keeping to myself.
There's definitely something not right with the systems. Too many outages.
I fly FPV drones out in the old freight sector sometimes.
Normally, it's quiet, but last week just felt crowded.
Heard signals scrambling in new ways. Didn’t linger.
Honestly, feels safer not talking much about it these days.
City’s been odd, for sure. Things stalling and scrambling.
I spend my time flying FPV drones off-grid in the industrial zone.
Last weekend, there were way more people flying than usual.
System glitches kept security drones off our backs for a while.
It was the first time in ages I wasn’t tracked out there.
Guess everyone's taking advantage while the city’s distracted.
City’s definitely acting up. Feels like the system is losing its grip a bit.
My hobby’s FPV drone flying, usually in those abandoned industrial lots.
Last Friday, it was packed with new flyers—system downtime maybe.
Security was random: checkpoint turrets rebooting, weird alerts on comms.
For a while, we all felt invisible, like the system forgot us.
I barely get moments like that. Unexpectedly freeing.
But I’m careful—no logs means no backup if something goes wrong.
Yeah, it’s been unpredictable since the referendum mess. Layers of the city breaking down.
I do freestyle FPV drone flying. Started after my brother disappeared—helps clear my head.
Usually, I track my drone flights for alibis, in case the system checks.
Last week, the yards were crowded. Some there for the first time. System gaps, I guess.
Security drones went silent partway through. Couple of us swapped blackout spots—makes it safer.
First time in years I flew without location tracking. Felt like I got something back.
Weird how some of us almost miss the oversight, just for structure.
Still, for people like me, those gaps are rare chances to breathe.
hobby_answer: Yeah, still flying when I can.
Had to pick spots with less interference lately.
Lot more flyers out now since the referendum mess.
Security drones got weird after those voting glitches.
No issues, just keeping my head down.
Still at it.
Seems everyone was out with drones last week after the voting started.
Signal got patchy when systems went haywire.
Security bots were wandering aimlessly by the yards.
Had to pull out faster than usual.
Not worth drawing attention right now.
Yeah, still dodging towers.
It got crowded at the yards after that BCI crash last week.
Felt different—no one cared about zones, just flying free.
Drones got knocked offline when security networks glitched.
Honestly, haven’t seen that many first-timers in years.
Tracking was off the whole night. Unusual.
I had to reroute to avoid getting flagged.
You know me. Nothing clears my head like those drone runs.
Last week, right after the referendum, the old logistic yards were packed.
People who never showed up before came out, like the whole city changed routine.
Part of me liked it—almost felt normal, nobody checking up on location logs.
But BCI was glitching bad—location trail blanked, security drones firing at random targets.
Saw one guy’s quad hit by a legacy turret, fried in seconds.
We flew anyway. Couldn’t resist that kind of freedom, even if it’s risky.
System came back up later, but the blackout... nice while it lasted.
Always. Only thing that actually makes the rest of it bearable.
Last blackout? That was the wildest open flying since the BCI pilot launched.
After the citywide vote, everyone poured into dead zones—like nobody cared about coverage anymore.
I marked a new circuit through warehouses I’d mapped years ago, never dared before.
Data uplinks crashed. My tracker didn’t ping location once—first time in, what, ages?
Security AI was down, old bots ran wild, saw some get bypassed entirely.
I kept log files on a backup chip, just in case, but nobody checked.
Felt almost dangerous but... honest. Like when I started, before my brother disappeared.
Makes me almost wish the whole system would stay unplugged, just for an hour more.
